content: The "Systemic Risk Designation Improvement Act of 2013" amends the table of contents for the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act by revising the authority to require enhanced supervision and regulation of certain nonbank financial companies and bank holding companies. The Dodd-Frank Act is amended to include enhanced supervision and regulation of certain bank holding companies, with the Council having the authority to make determinations on this matter. The Dodd-Frank Act allows the Council to determine if a bank holding company should be subject to enhanced supervision by the Board of Governors based on indicators like size, interconnectedness, and availability of substitutes. The Dodd-Frank Act allows the Council to determine enhanced supervision for bank holding companies based on indicators like size, interconnectedness, global activity, and complexity. The Dodd-Frank Act allows the Council to determine enhanced supervision for bank holding companies based on indicators like size, interconnectedness, global activity, and complexity. Section 115 of the Act is amended to update references in various subsections regarding bank holding companies and nonbank financial companies. The Dodd-Frank Act allows the Council to determine enhanced supervision for bank holding companies based on indicators like size, interconnectedness, global activity, and complexity. Section 115 of the Act is amended to update references in various subsections regarding bank holding companies and nonbank financial companies. Amendments include changes to subsections (a)(2) and (b)(3) of section 113, as well as modifications to sections 116(a) and 121 for companies subject to final determinations under section 113. (e) Mitigation.--Section 121 of the Dodd-Frank Act is amended to remove the threshold based on total consolidated assets and instead refer to companies subject to a final determination under section 113. Similarly, Section 155 is amended to reflect the same change in criteria for the Office of Financial Research. SEC. 4. REVISIONS TO BOARD AUTHORITY. The Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act is amended to remove the threshold of $50,000,000,000 for certain provisions and replace it with a final determination under section 113. This includes changes to acquisitions, management interlocks, and enhanced supervision and prudential standards.
